description: A call for purchase notice for a low temperature nano-positioning equipment with some additional requirements.
full_summary:
Advance Contract Award Notice
Quantum Sensors Challenge - Low Temperature Nanopositioning System
The National Research Council of Canada (NRC-CNRC) invites interested suppliers to participate in a public notice for the acquisition of a Low Temperature Nanopositioning System as part of the Quantum Sensors Challenge program. This notice indicates that the NRC-CNRC intends to award a contract to a pre-identified supplier, Attocube Systems AG, for the supply of the required system.

Background:
The Quantum Sensors Challenge program aims to develop quantum sensors that are orders of magnitude better than existing sensors. The program has a strong focus on advancing quantum sensing technologies towards adoption and commercialization. The NRC-CNRC has a requirement for a Low Temperature Nanopositioning System to support the development of quantum sensors in the photonics field.

Current Requirements:
The NRC-CNRC requires four additional Linear x-Nano positioners, two LinearX Nanopositioners, one Attocube motion controller, two Positioning Controllers, two scanning modules, and four Linear x-Nano positioners. The proposed system must be fully compatible with existing systems at the NRC-CNRC, including Attocube Fiber Coupled Microscopy systems and one Attocube linear x-Nanopositioner system.

Selection Criteria:
Suppliers who are interested in submitting a statement of capabilities must demonstrate their ability to meet the advertised requirements. Suppliers must ensure that their proposed systems are fully compatible with existing systems at the NRC-CNRC.

Important Dates:
* Closing date for acceptance of statements of capabilities: July 19, 2023, at 2:00 p.m. Eastern Time.
* Contract issuance: The contract is expected to be issued within 24 weeks of contract signing.

Notification:
The NRC-CNRC reserves the right to select a supplier from the received statements of capabilities and may award a contract without further competition.

Please note: This is an advance contract award notice: the Government has already determined who the contract will go to.

**Seeking Statements of Capabilities:**

Organizations who feel they meet the requirements are invited to submit a statement of capabilities to the address below.

* Address: Johnathon Gillis, Contracting Authority, National Research Council Canada, Procurement Services Directorate, 1200 Montreal Road, Building M55, Ottawa, Ontario, Canada K1A 0R6.
* Telephone: (343) 552-4124
* Email: Johnathon.Gillis@nrc-cnrc.gc.ca
